div.head: Contributors
div.p: The project has been conducted as a co-operation between the Department of Oriental Studies of the University of Vienna and the Austrian Centre of Digital Humanities of the Austrian Academy of Sciences (ACDH-OeAW). This group of researchers is committed to work in the spirit of Open Access and aim at making freely available for research as many digital language recources as possible.
VICAV is a collaborative undertaking. We are aiming at serving the community at large and want to be as inclusive as possible. Contact us if you want to participate in our efforts.
So far the following researchers have contributed to the pool of data.

div.head: Rima Aldoukhi
div.p: … is a first language speaker of Damascus Arabic and lecturer at the University of Vienna. She has been working extensively on the Damascus dictionary.

div.head: Carmen Berlinches Ramos
div.p: … has a PhD in Arabic Studies from the Complutense University of Madrid and is one of our Damascus specialists. She prepared many entries of the Damascus dictionary.

div.head: Asil Çetin
div.p: … was one of our web-design specialists.

div.head: Ines Dallaji
div.p: … is a specialist in Tunisian Arabic. She was working on the Tunisian dictionary and provided the language profile of Tunis.

div.head: Terlan Djavadova
div.p: … was a student assistent at the Institute of Oriental Studies of the University of Vienna. She has been working on several parts of the VICAV website, in particular the bibliography.

div.head: Aleksandra Ercegovčević
div.p: … is a student assistent at the University of Vienna and prepared many of the language profiles ( Aden, Alexandria, Algiers, al-Qatif, Al-Shirqat, Anjra, Baskinta, Cherchell, Constantine), Daragözü (today: Danagözü) , Deir ez-Zor, Dhofar, Ghazaouet, Ḥaḍramūt / Murah, Hauran, Jijel (formerly Djidjelli), Khartoum, Larache, Madaba, Mardin, Mazouna, Mzab, Oran, Ouled Brahim (Saïda), Palmyra, Sanaa, Saoura, Sidi Bel Abbès, Skoura, Taza, Tlemcen, Tripoli.

div.head: Ines Gabsi
div.p: … is a specialist in Tunisian Arabic and was working on the Tunisian dictionary.

div.head: Bettina Leitner
div.p: … is working on Khuzistan and provided the profiles of Ahwaz/Ahvaz, Basra, Chefchaouen, Chaouen, Fezzan, Hasankeyf, Hasköy, Hilla, Khawētna (tribe), Kuwait, Shukria tribe, Tétouan and Tillo.

div.head: Claudia Laaber
div.p: … is a student assistant working at the University of Vienna. She has been working tirelessly on the bibliography and the profiles. She provided the following profiles: Akko/Acre, Aleppo, Bethlehem, Birzeit, Fayyum, Gaza, Homs, Iksal, Irbid, Jaffa/ Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Jerusalem, Kerak Mecca, Ramla and Salt.

div.head: Charly Mörth
div.p: … prepared some of our Egyptian material. He takes a great interest in the interface between linguistics and digital language ressources doing research in the fields of virtual research environments and language related standards. Furthermore he contributed the profile for Cairo.

div.head: Lea Müller-Funk
div.p: … contributed to our MSA reference dictionary.

div.head: Stephan Procházka
div.p: … is professor of Arabic language at the University of Vienna. Between 2004 - 2015, he served as president of the International Association of Arabic Dialectology (AIDA). Together with Charly Moerth he initiated the VICAV project. Stephan also provided the profiles of Adana, al-Khaburah, Arwad, Baghdad, Damascus, Haifa, Hama, Mhardeh, Sa'dah, Şanlıurfa and Tihama (Yemen).

div.head: Veronika Ritt-Benmimoun
div.p: … is assistant professor of Arabic linguistics at the Institute of Oriental Studies of the University of Vienna and a leading specialist in Tunisian Bedouin dialects. She has compiled the profile on Douz.

div.head: Daniel Schopper
div.p: … has been behind most of the technical developments in VICAV, both assisting setting up the application, working on workflows, designing the TEI model of large parts of the infrastructure.

div.head: Naima Sekiati
div.p: … is lecturer for Moroccan Arabic at the University of Vienna and prepared the profile of Salé.

div.head: Omar Siam
div.p: … was the chief developer of the first VICAV website and has taken care of some essential parts of the XQuery component of the VICAV website.

div.head: Anna Telič
div.p: … was lecturer for Syrian Arabic at the University of Vienna and has been responsible for the re-checking of the data in the Damascus dictionary.

div.head: Fady Yousuf
div.p: … has been working on the Baghdad dictionary.

div.head: Other Contributors
div.p: A number of MA and PhD students in Arabic Studies at the University of Vienna contributed profiles to this website. Among these are Julia Baumgartner (Soukhne / Al-Sukhnah), Natanja Faschinger Sousse, Lea Bäumler Mosul, Marlene Holzmann Tozeur Maria El Fadel Qamishli, Karoline Köster Tiberias, Sherin Elkaffas Benghazi, Qasim Hassan Basra, Stephanie Sarg Abu Dhabi and Benjamin Suter Taizz.
